Lore.name: Lore
Lore.text:
Toyama was a stoic and disciplined town guard until one night when a gnoll invasion descended upon his town. Chaos ensued as the gnolls pillaged and burned everything in their path. The eerie echoes of their sadistic laughter mingled with the screams of innocent civilians, creating a symphony of terror.

Helplessly trapped amidst the onslaught, Toyama witnessed his worst nightmare come to life. He watched in horror as his family fell victim to the gnolls' savage blades. The sight of their lifeless bodies shattered something deep within him.

With a soul consumed by grief and madness, Toyama embraced a darkness that matched the gnolls' vile nature. In a fit of uncontrollable rage he charged headlong into the gnoll camp, his crazed and maniacal laughter echoing in the night.

Blows rained down upon the gnolls, bone shattering and blood spattering with every swing of Toyama's flail. His laughter twisted into a haunting, manic sound that sent shivers down the spines of those who still clung to their fleeting lives. The gnolls fought desperately, but Toyama's berserker fury was unmatched, fueled by an insatiable thirst for revenge.

When dawn broke, casting an ethereal glow over the scene, the gnoll camp was left in ruin. The once ferocious horde lay slain. But amidst the carnage, there was no sign of Toyama. All that remained was his bloodied flail, abandoned in the midst of the gnoll corpses.

Trinket.text:
Clockwork Heart

Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement)

"Few things in this world are rarer than magic, yet an artwork infused with magic is a treasure beyond compare."

Clockwork Heart is a gold crafted magical artifact resembling a full-sized heart. This magnificent creation, from the ornate clocks to the myriad of tiny gears and various mechanical components, has been crafted to evoke a sense of both artistry and functionality.

When attuned, the Clockwork Heart transcends its physical form, merging with your heart, becoming an integral part of your body.

Art Collector's Intuition. You can appraise the value of art objects with uncanny accuracy.

The Clockwork Heart has a total of 10 charges, and each of its abilities can be activated as a bonus action. It regains [[/r 2d4 + 2]] expended charges after a long rest. If you consume all of the charges, you suffer one level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.JournalEntry.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion}.

When you activate abilities, your form briefly shudders, and you become enveloped in golden, patterns.

  • Gears of Haste (6 charges). Consume 6 charges to dramatically increase your heart rate, allowing you to take an additional action on your current turn.

  • Radiant Flourish (5 charges). Consume 5 charges to imbue your weapons with radiant energy for 1 minute, granting a +1 bonus to attack and 1d6 extra radiant damage on each hit.

  • Mechanical Strike (5 charges). Consume 5 charges to gain an extra attack on your current turn.

  • Swift Gearshift (4 charges). Consume 4 charges to double your movement speed on your current turn.

Side Effect:

  • Artistic Obsession. You develop an overwhelming love for art. You become emotionally invested in the preservation and appreciation of art, to the point where you can become visibly upset when encountering art in poor condition or being mistreated. This obsession can lead you to take extraordinary measures to protect and restore art, even to the detriment of your other goals or relationships.

Roleplay Suggestions:

  • You might find yourself constantly seeking out art galleries, museums, and rare collectors to ensure their art is well-maintained.
  • You may become a patron of the arts, supporting struggling artists and funding art restoration projects.
  • Your emotional reactions to damaged or neglected art can lead to humorous or tense situations in social interactions, especially when others don't share your passion for art.
  • The curse could drive you to investigate art-related mysteries and quests, uncovering hidden truths about valuable pieces and their creators.

Lore.name: Lore
Lore.text:
In a distant land where creativity and magic coalesce, there existed a legendary guild of artists and craftsmen known as the Guild of Eternal Creators. These visionary craftsmen were revered for their unique ability to blend the mystic arts with mechanical ingenuity, creating magical contraptions that pushed the boundaries of what was thought possible.

One of this creation was the Clockwork Heart, a masterfully crafted magical object shaped like a heart. It was created by one of the guild's most renowned artificer, Vaelin Gearhart. The artifact was a manifestation of Vaelin's artistic vision and a tribute to his lifelong passion.

In the pursuit of pushing the boundaries of art and magic, the guild had been experimenting with the creation of a portal that would allow them to access new realms of inspiration and raw magical energy. These experiments went awry, resulting in the violent opening of the Artifex Abyss, a tear in the fabric of reality that consumed the guild's sanctuary and surrounding land.

Many of the guild's creations, including the Clockwork Hearth, were lost in the rift and transported to other planes of existence.

The landscape is filled with chaos and destruction, a chaotic scene - a battlefield between demons and humans. The sky, a deep red, illuminated by flashes of lightning that light up the clouds of blood raining down from the heavens. The air is filled with the cries of pain and desperation, and the clash of steel against steel.

In the middle of the chaotic landscape, an intimidating creature is killing everything in its path with relentless fury. The demon has an impressive stature with slender horns framing its face, each one crowned with sharp crystals. Its eyes are pure gold, and its skin is a deep purple hue, like volcanic lava. It has massive wings, both made of ebony feathers that ripple like ink when it moves. Its hands wields an ancient blade with an angelic-winged hilt. He fills the air with the sound of destruction and the ground trembles beneath its feet and nothing can stand in his way as it rampages across the battlefield.

Suddenly, a frail silhouette appears behind the creature, a man dressed in a robe that was once white, but now stained with blood. He places his hand on the demon's head and instantly a beam of light emerges from the unstained white glove and splitting the demon in two. The man roars in agony and shock ripples through the air. His face shifts and changes, aging and then regaining its youth in a continuous cycle.

Helmet.name: 头盔
Helmet.text:
Pyro Head - The Infernal Crown

Wondrous Item, legendary (requires attunement by a fighter, sorcerer, wizard, warlock or rogue)

"There is a fire inside. Watch the flames, the ancient, flickering of the relic's essence and become reborn."

The Infernal Crown, known also as the Pyro Head, is a relic forged in the heart of a extinguished volcano. The helm resembles a skull engulfed in flames.

Ember Gaze. As an action, you can unleash a gaze attack from the Pyro Head. Three rays shoot forth from the helm's eyes and mouth, targeting the nearest three creatures within a 30-foot cone. Each targeted creature must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 17). On a failed save, the creature takes 6d6 fire damage. On a successful save, they take half damage. If a creature dies from this attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage the creature took.

This ability can be use twice per long rest.

Firewalk. You gain the ability to walk on the surface of lava or other molten substances as if they were solid ground. You leave no trail of fire behind and you are unharmed by the heat.

Inferno Barrier. You are immune to environmental heat damage and resistant to any fire-based attacks or spells.

Intimidating Aura. You gain a +5 bonus to Intimidation checks and a -5 penalty to Persuasion checks.

Curse. When the Infernal Crown is donned, the helm fuses with you, becoming unremovable. During this time, your head takes the appearance of a burning skull, wreathed in fire (the fire is harmless and does not emit heat and light). The helm cannot be removed as long as you live.

Glove.name: Glove
Glove.text:
Glove of Healing Slap

Wondrous item, rare (does not require attunement)

"A slap to heal, a grin to seal, and a hand-shaped trace to embrace. This glove is the jest of jests, and it'll leave you with a face that's truly blessed!"

This magical glove is made from leather in shades of green, red, and yellow, adorned with colorful, jester-themed patterns and bells that jingle with each movement.

Healing Slap. While wearing these gloves, you can take an action to deliver a vigorous slap on a willing or incapacitated creature within 5 feet of you. The creature regains hit points equal to [[/roll 4d6]] plus your Wisdom modifier. The slap leaves a comically shaped handprint on the creature's face, which fades away after 4 hours. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 17) to avoid the slap.

You can use this ability once per long rest.

Lore.name: Lore
Lore.text:
Lore. Legend has it that the Glove of Healing Slap was created by the magician-jester, who was known throughout the kingdom for his daring magical experiments and relentless pursuit of knowledge.

One day, the jester was granted the opportunity to perform for the king. He saw this as a chance to impress him and gain access to more funds for his magical research.

During his performance, he boldly slapped the king across the face, which initially sent the entire court into stunned silence. The king, infuriated by the audacity of the jester, was about to demand his immediate arrest. However, the scar on his face, a memento from an old hunting accident, started to glow and gradually faded away.

As the king's anger transformed into amazement the jester said: "You see, Your Majesty, life is just a never-ending jest, and sometimes, all you need is a good slap to remind you to smile again!"

    • During the daytime the ring heals the touched individual for 2d4 hit points.

    • During the nighttime, the ring unveils its true nature, dealing 2d4 necrotic damage to the individual it touches.

  4. After the first use of the ring during the night, the item's description in the player's inventory will update to reveal its nighttime effects.

  5. The ring will post distinct messages in the chat log based on whether it's used during the day or at night. Please ensure that the item's description is not manually altered, as this may disrupt the proper display of these messages unless the modification is done with a clear understanding of the underlying mechanics.

Stormforger

Weapon (quarterstaff), legendary (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, druid or wizard)

“"Behold the power of the great storm!" the wizard shouted, as the orb on top of the staff began to swirl with a furious intensity. "Feel its wrath, and fear its might!" The air around crackled with raw energy, and the winds began to howl. Lightning bolts flew from the staff, crashing into the ground and sending shockwaves through the air. The storm was coming, and no one could stand in its way.”

The Stormforger staff is carved from a single piece of lightning-struck wood. The staff has a glowing orb made of pure crystal at the top which pulsates with energy and contains miniature tempests within. The shaft is lightweight and gives off a faint hum when held.

This staff is not meant for melee attacks but while you hold it, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged spell attack rolls and it has 10 charges. It regains 1d4 + 2 expended charges after a long rest. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 20, the staff regains 2d4 + 2 charges.

While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend its charges unleashing the following abilities using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier:

Tornado Takedown. Expending 2 charges allows you to summon a tornado that travels to a creature within 60 feet. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save it takes [[/r 1d6]] bludgeoning damage and [[/r 2d6]] lightning damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and is not @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated}.

Aerial Ascension. Expending 5 charges you can harness the power of the tempest and summon a whirlwind beneath your feet, allowing flight for 10 minutes. The maximum altitude that can be reached while flying is 30 feet.

Thunderstorm of Misery. Expending 9 charges you can unleash the full potential of the Stormforger, summoning a powerful storm that rages around you in a 50-foot radius for 1 minute. The storm creates dangerous terrain, making the ground slippery and filled with debris, making it difficult for creatures within the area of effect to move around. The howling winds, lightning strikes and heavy rain make it hard for creatures to see or hear, imposing disadvantage on any perception checks made while within the storm. The storm also unleashes bolts of lightning, forcing creatures within the affected area, to make a Dexterity saving throw. Greatsword.text:
Queen's Burden

Weapon (greatsword), rare (requires attunement)

"Nothing should be taken lightly by a monarch. Even the sword he wields must reflect the burden of his decisions, its blade carrying the weight of choices, that signal the responsibilities borne with each strike."

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Only creatures with a Strength of 19 or higher can make attack rolls with this sword.

The Queen's Burden, an imposing greatsword, emanates authority with its beautifully proportioned form. The massive blade offers a clean mirrored polished finish. The crossguard, resembling an elegant crown, emphasizes the sword's regal theme.

Regal Harvest. When you slay a humanoid creature with Queen's Burden, the sword gains 15 lbs (6.8 kg) in weight, and the damage it deals increases by 1.

Monarch's Wrath. After Queen's Burden gains 150 lbs (68 kg), it becomes unstable, and you must use Monarch's Wrath on your next attack. The sword releases its energy, splitting the ground in a 40ft line. Creatures in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take damage and are knocked prone. On a success, they take half damage and remain standing. After using Monarch's Wrath, Queen's Burden loses the bonus damage and the extra weight.

Lore.name: Lore
Lore.text:
In this kingdom there is a tradition that dictate the path to leadership. Every year, representatives from each royal house emerged as champions to partake in a grand tournament. The stakes were high, for the last standing champion would face the current monarch, a queen who has reigned for many years.

The Queen's Burden is her sword, and it is said that the sword increases in weight with every kill. Nobody knows how the queen handles the heavy sword, but there is a rumor that her ancestry is traced back to a mysterious lineage of giants known for their immense strength.

The legendary weapon known as Yarte Pora, a name shrouded in mystic echoes, carries a tale that spans across worlds and planes.

The weapon derives its powers from a God hailing from another plane of existence. This deity, Yar'tel Poralis, met his demise in a cataclysmic battle between gods, and on the brink of death, he infused a fragment of his essence into his weapon. Through an otherworldly enchantment, he set the weapon on a transcendent journey across realms, waiting for a hero deserving of its divine might.

Aspects of evil will try to block the hero's path in his mission to fulfill the God's will. Eventually, with enough Divine Power, the God will be able to guide the hero to his now-destroyed home world to face his nemesis.

Suggestions:

At the beginning of the journey, the player can obtain the Rare variant of Yarte Pora. This version of the weapon is already quite formidable, but its true potential lies dormant. The character could periodically receive visions or guidance from the god Yar'tel Poralis, directing it on the right path.

As the player progresses in their quest and accomplishes significant feats in the name of the fallen god, it gains access to the Very Rare Variant.

The Legendary Variant, representing the peak of Yarte Pora's potential, can be accessible only when the hero reaches the pinnacle of their quest, such as confronting the ancient nemesis on the ruined home world.

Cloak of Spectral Echoes

Wondrous Item (cape), rare (requires attunement)

"The spectral twin, born of intention, gracefully mirrors the subtleties of my motions."

The Cloak of Spectral Echoes appears as a flowing, midnight-blue garment adorned with silver threads that seem to weave in and out of reality.

The cloak has 3 charges. It regains expended charges after a long rest.

Spectral Echo. As a bonus action, you can expend one charge to create a spectral duplicate that merges with you, occupying the same space. This intangible duplicate mirrors your movements, granting you advantage on all your attacks and imposing disadvantage on attacks against you. These effects last for 1 minute or until you are hit by an attack.

Quest Inspiration.name: Quest Inspiration
Quest Inspiration.text:
The armor is known as the Shadows Refuge, and it was created by a master leatherworker named Aiden Steelshadow. Aiden was once a member of an elite group of assassins, but after a failed mission that resulted in the death of his closest friends, he left the guild in disgust. He believed that the guild had become too focused on profit and power, and had lost sight of its original goal to protect the innocent and eliminate evil.

After the massacre of his comrades, Aiden was haunted by their memory. Determined to continue his quest for justice, he turned to crafting and devoted himself to creating the perfect armor for stealthy and deadly combat, one that would allow him to continue his mission for revenge. He spent years researching rare materials and enchantments, experimenting with different designs and techniques, until he finally succeeded in creating the Shadows Refuge.

The armor is made of lightweight leather, enchanted with powerful magic that allows it to absorb and manipulate shadows. This allows the wearer to blend seamlessly into the shadows and become almost invisible, even in broad daylight.

However, the creation of the armor came at a cost. Aiden had to sacrifice his own life force to infuse the armor with magic. With his dying breath, he hid the armor, believing that it would be too dangerous in the wrong hands.

Mechanics.name: 机制
Mechanics.text:
1. To use this item, you must equip and attune to it.

  2. This item should not be equipped by more than one player at the same time.

  3. Before being equipped to a Player or an NPC, the item's name can be modified. Once it has been equipped, further renaming is not advised.

  4. Select a target on the map then click the item icon in your inventory to use it.

    A pop-up menu will appear to confirm your target. If you press Ok, Shadow Dwelling ability will be activated. Everything you will do from now on, will have to be done by pressing the armor icon in the inventory.

    • Example 1: If you want to attack, click the armor icon of the item in your inventory. A pop-up menu will appear with 3 choices. Select Deadly Strike and chose a melee weapon that you have equipped to make an attack action. After the attack, you will step out from the shadow, you will get 1 level of Exhaustion and if you kill your target your item charge will refill.

    • Example 2: After you drink a potion or use another item, click the armor icon of the item in your inventory. A pop-up menu will appear with 3 choices. Select Other Action to automatically roll a Dexterity check. If you succeed, you will remain in the shadow. If you fail, you will step out from the shadow and you will get 1 level of Exhaustion.

    • Example 3: If you want to move, click the armor icon of the item in your inventory. A pop-up menu will appear with 3 choices. Select Exit From Shadow to step out of shadow. You will automatically get 1 level of Exhaustion.

Armor.name: 护甲
Armor.text:
Shadows Refuge

Armor (light armor), legendary (requires attunement)

“The bandit walked down the dimly lit street, his heart pounding in his chest. He couldn't shake the feeling that someone, or something, was following him. He continued to look over his shoulder, but all he could see was his own shadow, elongated by the flickering street lamps. Suddenly, he heard a voice whisper in his ear, "No matter how fast you run, you can't outrun the shadows." The man froze in horror. He felt a cold blade piercing his back, pain rushing through his body. He looked down and saw the blade coming out from his chest and blood pouring out, staining the pavement. He knew it was too late for forgiveness.”

You have a +2 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. While attuned to it you have advantage on Stealth checks.

Shadow Dwelling. As a bonus action, you can select the shadow of a creature within a maximum range of 30 feet that you can see. You inhabit that creature's shadow for up to 1 minute or until you choose to end it. While in the shadow, your vision becomes monochromatic, and your vision range is limited to 5 feet. You gain immunity to all damage but you are vulnerable to Radiant damage. You can only be seen with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.eVtpEGXjA2tamEIJ.JournalEntryPage.8iC24otVX4n1yrYw]{Truesight} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.eVtpEGXjA2tamEIJ.JournalEntryPage.I6ABWHBYwGl55dLY]{Blindsight}.

Exhaustion. When you step out of the shadow, you gain 1 level of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cspWveykstnu3Zcv]{Exhaustion}. Every time you use your action, you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 15) to maintain your presence within the shadow. On a failed save, you automatically step out from the shadow.

Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

Deadly Strike. As an action, you can make one attack from the creature's shadow and you can only target the creature whose shadow you currently inhabit. This attack has advantage and deals triple damage. If you reduce the target to 0 hit points with this attack, you can use "Shadow Dwelling" again on your next turn.
